name: Bl. Peter Faber

locations.description: One of the first Jesuits, companion of Ignatius

summary: Peter Faber was a French Jesuit priest who was one of the first companions of St. Ignatius of Loyola and one of the first seven Jesuits. He was known for his skill in giving the Spiritual Exercises and for his work in Germany during the early years of the Reformation. He was a close friend of both Ignatius and Francis Xavier. He was beatified in 1872.
